department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Introduction to Human Rights and Justice
course.description: This course seeks to give an introduction to contemporary discussions about justice, human rights, and religion. It will survey the conceptions of rights within political theology and within contemporary theories of justice. Special attention will be given to the work of Rawls, Habermas, Nussbaum, Sen, Walzer, Sandel, Motlmann, Woltersdorf, and Schmitt. It will seek to show how a conception of human rights relates to religion with the framework of a discourse ethics.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 2801.
